intro: Prismatocarpus implicatus, commonly known as the Malabar plum. It is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India, characterized by its fragrant, yellowish-white flowers and elliptical, fleshy fruits. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is known for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and fruit. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. The fruit is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor, making it a valued species in local horticulture.
